fields.description: Walking down the thoroughfare, you encounter a group of rough-looking locals shoving a young lad. You hear shouts of "Thief!" and "Show us where you hid it!"
fields.title: A Commotion in the Street

fields.description: A group of deer runs past, keeping a cautious distance but well within sight. Will you pursue them?
fields.title: Swift Stags

fields.description: A battered wooden chest with strong iron clamps rests insolently on the ground. Does it dare keep its treasure from you?
fields.title: A Locked Chest!

fields.description: The skies are clear this evening, and you pause to look at the shimmering lights above. A single bright flash appears long enough for you to trace its path. According to superstition, wishes made in the wake of a star's passing are more likely to come true. For what will you wish?
fields.title: Shooting Star

fields.description: You meet a man who claims to be a master of the ether. For a few coins he will travel with you for the day and share its mysteries with you.
fields.title: Wandering Teacher

fields.description: Some creature has been snacking on your rations! At least, you presume that's the the reason for the hole chewed in your pack, the removal of rations and the addition of crumbs.
fields.title: Vermin!

fields.description: You step into the inviting warmth of a nearby tavern. Ale is flowing, tongues are loosened, and everyone seems to have a tale to tell. To whom will you listen?
fields.title: Tavern Tales

fields.description: A brother and sister call to you for help. They went to market two days earlier, but have not been able to find their way back home. They aren't sure exactly where their home is. Will you help them?
fields.title: Lost Children

fields.description: While hopping from stone to stone over a particularly wide steam, you notice a flash of light from beneath the water. It looks like someone lost their purse while making a similar leap, and now their coins lie under three feet of swiftly rushing water.
fields.title: Coins in the River

fields.description: A local promontory looms over the landscape. Several rough trails seem to offer passage up its slope.
fields.title: To the Mountaintop

fields.description: An irate farmer is trying to get rid of the starlings that have been devouring his berry crop, and will pay you to assist him.
fields.title: Clear the Field

fields.description: Books are precious and rare in Skal, so it's unusual to see them sold this openly. A gaunt man wearing once-respectable clothing offers to part with some of his treasures for a few coins.
fields.title: The Way of the Book

fields.description: A fellow-traveler has reached the respectable age of thirty, and decided to hang up his adventuring sword for good. He's one of the lucky few who chose the right side in their fights, saved their coins, and got out before they were cut down. He and his wife just had their first son, and he intends to collect some memorable artifacts for his child's future.
fields.title: Calling All Adventurers

fields.description: You notice a sign hanging outside of a butcher shop: "Need a fresh supply of animals."
fields.title: Meet the Meat

fields.description: The butcher has asked you and Tomas to round up some grazing cattle outside of town.
fields.title: Corral Some Cattle

fields.description: The town's mutton supplies are dropping perilously low, and several large flocks have recently wandered off. Can you find some mature sheep for the butcher?
fields.title: Wooly Wanderers

fields.description: The town used to keep many pigs in fenced pens, but over the years many have escaped and now feral swine roam the forests nearby.
fields.title: Pernicious Pigs

fields.description: Many of the elite in town have recently developed a taste for rabbit: rabbit stew, rabbit roasts, grilled rabbit in an apricot glaze. The unexpected demand has caught the butcher unprepared, and he asks you to help refresh his stocks.
fields.title: Rare Rabbits

fields.description: The butcher has heard strange tales lately. A creature the locals have taken to calling the boagar has been sighted around town. Always appearing at dusk or at dawn, it supposedly has the body of a cougar but the tusks of a boar.
fields.title: A Mythical Beast?

fields.description: You've gathered a great deal of circumstantial evidence regarding the so-called "boagar", a beast with the body of a cougar and the tusks of a boar. The butcher has offered you a significant prize if you can capture or kill the animal and bring it in for the town to see.
fields.title: Capture the Beast!

fields.description: Like many villages, this town defers to the wisdom of local leaders. The Patriarch still has overall authority, but for matters beneath his attention, the village elder is expected to rule. The last elder died several months ago, and two men are bitterly contesting the succession. If you back the winner, you would gain a useful ally.
fields.title: The New Elder

fields.description: If you are going to represent them to the populace, you'll need to get to know the elder better. What strengths can they offer? What topics should they avoid?
fields.title: A Chat with the Elder-in-Waiting

fields.description: Ultimately, the Patriarch will appoint the new elder. In these modern times, though, Patriarchs are wary of the country peasants and city laborers. You don't necessarily need their support, but you'll want to make sure they don't cause trouble.
fields.title: Consulting the Commoners

fields.description: The men who sell food, clothing, and lodging to the town's residents have a great deal of influence in the selection of a new elder. Try to convince them to use that influence in your favor.
fields.title: Mingling with the Merchants

fields.description: Descor, a powerful nephew of the Patriarch, has been seen traveling through town. No doubt he has important business to attend, but a word in his ear could have an enormous impact on the elder's selection.
fields.title: Influencing Descor

fields.description: Neither Blacksmith Peter nor Drygoodsman Sam are technically the eldest man in the village. That honor belongs to Old Andrew, who has loudly denied any desire for the chair, but whose opinion will still carry a great deal of weight in the decision.
fields.title: Old Andrew

fields.description: The Patriarch's agent is ready to choose the new elder. He has asked to speak with you in private before the appointment is official.
fields.title: An Audience with Descor

fields.description: Your two feet have served you well thus far, but four feet would allow you to cover ground much more quickly and ease travel to nearby Houses.
fields.title: Your Steed

fields.description: Temor, a distant nephew to Patriarch Naper, has been spotted in town. Nobody seems to know his business, but he does appear to spend an inordinate amount of time in the tavern.
fields.title: Catching Spies

fields.description: Sam the drygoodsman sold Temor supplies when he last passed through town. He may have had opportunity to look in his satchel while loading his horse.
fields.title: Investigate the Drygoodsman

fields.description: Temor employed a guide when he passed this way before. She usually hunts animals in the forest. Can you remain hidden and observe her movements?
fields.title: Chase the Huntress

fields.description: Temor had sent several less-important messages back to the Patriarch with a local boy. He believes that the boy never saw the secret documents, but wants you to make sure.
fields.title: Trail the Messenger

fields.description: Nobody knows his name, but the limping adventurer arrived in town around the same time as Temor. Nobody knows how he can earn a living in his reduced state.
fields.title: Follow a Limping Adventurer

fields.description: Her name wasn't on Temor's list, but you've heard rumors of his dalliance with the tavernkeeper's daughter. If you're going to be thorough in your job, you'll need to investigate her connections as well.
fields.title: Shadow the Mistress

fields.description: You have been following Temor's suspects for long enough. It's time to make your report.
fields.title: Accusation

fields.description: Chase down the slowest of the herd. This will provide plenty of food for your journey!
fields.title: Dinner's On

fields.description: The buck in front sports a magnificent rack. It will be hard to take this one, and doing so will prove your hunting prowess.
fields.title: A Fine Trophy

fields.description: What did the deer ever do to you?
fields.title: Let Them Pass

fields.description: You're outnumbered here. Best to keep quiet and not do anything rash.
fields.title: Observe the Fray

fields.description: Now's the time for action. A swift display of force will make them think twice about their actions.
fields.title: Rescue the Lad

fields.description: In your experience, it doesn't take much to change the focus of an angry mob.
fields.title: Create a Distraction

fields.description: That's what a lockpick is for, right?
fields.title: Pick the Lock

fields.description: May tales of your exploits spread throughout the land!
fields.title: Wish for Fame

fields.description: The world has plenty. You deserve some.
fields.title: Wish for Wealth

fields.description: Many wise men study the stars, so they must have secrets worth knowing.
fields.title: Wish for Wisdom

fields.description: Why strive? Enjoy the time you have.
fields.title: Wish for Happiness

fields.description: Not enough royals for full instruction? For the price of a flagon of ale, he will give you a few tips.
fields.title: A brief lesson

fields.description: Too few people in Skal know the Ether's mysteries, and even fewer are willing to share its secrets. Learn as much as you can from this opportunity.
fields.title: A full course

fields.description: So he thinks he can teach you of the Ether, does he? Let there be a contest of powers between you! The victor shall win a respectable purse with the spoils!
fields.title: A contest

fields.description: Surely the beast will return, and when it does, you shall be ready.
fields.title: Lay a Trap

fields.description: The man leaning against the bar has bright red hair, a bushy beard, and no fingers. He claims to have fought in the Tanalga River War, and have tales that will chill your spine.
fields.title: Listen to a Wounded Veteran

fields.description: Judging from the guffaws emerging from the well-lit corner, this heavy-lidded man is more amusing than he looks.
fields.title: Listen to a Jovial Jokester

fields.description: Several women gathered around a table are exchanging market information in intense but quiet conversation. Such people don't take kindly to interlopers.
fields.title: Listen to the Well-Informed Traders

fields.description: With peoples' attentions so distracted, it would take little effort to relieve them of their burdensome purses.
fields.title: Work the Crowd

fields.description: It may take most of the day, but you can't abide the thought of these children wandering around unattended.
fields.title: Escort them home

fields.description: Your time is valuable! You intend to keep track of the hours spent in the search, so you can politely close up accounts with their father later.
fields.title: Escort them home... for a price

fields.description: Sure, it looks dangerous; that's why their previous owner left them here. A little water's nothing to be afraid of. How about a lot of water?
fields.title: Make a dive

fields.description: No, there's no compelling reason to climb it... but that's not about to stop you!
fields.title: Because It's There

fields.description: If you take your time, you probably won't reach the summit by nightfall... but you will probably enjoy the climb more.
fields.title: Climb Slowly and Carefully

fields.description: The farmer hasn't had much luck with his old shortbow, but perhaps your eyes and reflexes will serve you better. If you can shoot a few of the scavengers, the rest should get the message.
fields.title: Hail of Arrows

fields.description: The stationary scarecrow doesn't seem to be making any impact. Perhaps if you wheel around and holler loudly, you can frighten them off.
fields.title: Flailing and Screaming

fields.description: It feels a little like overkill, but with enough work you should be able to erect a barrier out of the ether that will repel avian intruders.
fields.title: Invisible Dome

fields.description: You've heard that this book's theories have been discredited, but there may still be some worthwhile knowledge hidden amongst the dross.
fields.title: Choose Ethereal Mysteries

fields.description: All the rage when you were growing up, most of this tome's techniques have been well learned by serious swordsmen already, and they are wise to its tricks.
fields.title: Choose an Illustrated Guide to Swordplay

fields.description: No man owning this tome could have ever been truly respectable. This is a guide for aspiring lockpickers, only thinly disguised as a resource for lockbox owners who have thoughtlessly misplaced their keys.
fields.title: Choose Guile's Guide to Locks

fields.description: "I remember well how I stumbled into the adventuring life. I had agreed to help my uncle move some carpets to the fair at a nearby town. Halfway there, we were attacked by highwaymen who had set up a barricade at the crossroads. There were three of them and only one of me, but I don't think they expected a fight! I grabbed the club from their leader's hand, and delivered a beating to the three of them before smashing down that barricade. I remember that there was a sign nearby, with the symbol of a fox standing upright. If you can find that sign, please bring it to me, and I'll pay its weight in copper coin."
fields.title: Locate the Ominous Crossroads

fields.description: It sounds like the man could use your services... assuming you aren't the animal, of course.
fields.title: Volunteer

fields.description: Cows are notoriously large and slow, so even though this particular herd is free-ranging, they shouldn't be too hard to locate.
fields.title: Find Them

fields.description: Few things are as docile and unintelligent as a sheep. Finding them will take persistence, but little skill.
fields.title: Sheep Herder

fields.description: They can be hard to spot in the undergrowth, and you need to be careful to not get skewered by a charging boar. If you can find the herd's lair, though, you should be able to bring plenty of pork back to the butcher.
fields.title: Track a Porker

fields.description: A rabbit's speed, small size, and habitat all make pursuit tricky. You'll need to be especially observant to find some.
fields.title: Warren Chaser

fields.description: If the creature actually exists, it must leave some signs behind. Visit the areas where it was spotted and look for anything unusual.
fields.title: Track the Animal

fields.description: You feel confident that, if you can set aside enough provisions to stake out an area non-stop for several days, you will be able to find the creature. Assuming it actually exists, of course.
fields.title: Capture the Boagar

fields.description: It seems foolish to wait for days in hopes that a possibly-mythical animal appears. On the other hand, the forest is filled with boars, and you can probably find a cougar. A little work with a knife, and you might be able to pull off the scam.
fields.title: Create a Boagar

fields.description: Sam Yole is one of the richest men in town. He owns the largest store, controls shipments, and rents out many dwellings. Much of the town's merchant community backs him, perhaps out of fear.
fields.title: Back the Drygoodsman

fields.description: Peter Barst adventured throughout Skal for many years before settling down to practice his trade here, and has earned respect throughout the House for the quality of his blades. While the town respects him and his work ethic, many still see him as an outsider.
fields.title: Back the Blacksmith

fields.description: Sam has considerable knowledge about the town's history and culture. You might be able to learn something that will be useful later.
fields.title: Speak with Sam

fields.description: Peter is unusually reticent for someone seeking to rule a village. See if you can draw him out in conversation.
fields.title: Parlay with Peter

fields.description: Spend an hour speaking with the poor, the un-landed, and other minor personages.
fields.title: Canvas in the Village

fields.description: As a general rule, the mercantile class prefers to maintain the status quo. You can encourage that preference and point out the importance of swiftly filling the elder's chair.
fields.title: Point Out the Benefits

fields.description: You spy Descor riding down the thoroughfare. Most people give him a respectful berth, giving you an opportunity to get close.
fields.title: Waylay in the Street

fields.description: You doubt Descor means to ride all the way back to the Household today. If you keep a low profile, you may be able to find him in a more accessible location.
fields.title: Follow Him

fields.description: Andrew has seen enough of both men to know all their faults. Convince him of the benefits your elder offers.
fields.title: Impress Andrew

fields.description: You have prepared a long list of reasons why Sam Yole will be the most capable and loyal elder. You are also authorized to pay a small bribe, should the opportunity arise.
fields.title: Convince Him to Choose Sam

fields.description: Peter's fame extends beyond the town, and would add to the prestige of the House.
fields.title: Convince Him to Choose Peter

fields.description: You haven't been impressed by Peter's campaigning skills, and Sam has hinted that he will pay you a large bribe if you smooth his path to victory.
fields.title: Switch Allegiance to Sam

fields.description: You've grown increasingly disillusioned with the heavy-handed approach Sam takes to town culture. Peter remains something of an enigma, but he strikes you as a more honest fellow.
fields.title: Switch Allegiance to Peter

fields.description: The local stable has a mare for sale. She looks like a quiet, temperate creature.
fields.title: Buy a Horse

fields.description: The locals have a bad habit of leaving their mounts unattended when they visit the tavern. If you're quick, you might be able to make off with a mount before anyone notices.
fields.title: Steal a Horse

fields.description: Temor is sitting by himself at a low table in the tavern, scratching out a letter and muttering to himself about spies. See if you can glean more information from him.
fields.title: Approach Temor

fields.description: Sam's an easy man to find. Try to remain unseen while lurking in or near his store to see if he is meeting with anyone suspicious.
fields.title: Spy on Sam

fields.description: The huntress is traveling on foot today. See if she meets with anyone suspicious.
fields.title: Shadow Her Trail

fields.description: The lad seems to be about fifteen years old, and has built quite a business for himself by delivering letters, both in town and between villages. See if any of his customers are buying information.
fields.title: Observe the Boy's Meetings

fields.description: The limping adventurer has rented a small but private room over the tavern. If he is corresponding with any enemies of the House, you may be able to find evidence inside.
fields.title: Investigate His Room

fields.description: A steady flow of customers pass in and out of the tavern's doors, and most of them will exchange at least a few words with the mistress. Try to remain unobtrusive and overhear their conversations.
fields.title: Eavesdropping Again

fields.description: The messenger is the most likely suspect: he had access to Temor's information, he regularly travels to other areas, and he has been seen in the company of foreigners.
fields.title: Accuse the Messenger

fields.description: The timing of his arrival seems too fortunate to be a mere coincidence. Adventurers like him have many contacts in foreign lands, and he could have known that the Patriarch's secrets would fetch a high price.
fields.title: Accuse the Limping Adventurer

fields.description: It's risky to accuse a man's lover of a crime, so be sure you're confident in your evidence.
fields.title: Accuse the Mistress

fields.name: Family Legacy
fields.description: You agreed to help a retired adventurer secure objects for his children's future.

fields.name: Acquiring Animals
fields.description: Local butchers have recruited you to hunt some animals.

fields.name: Choosing an Elder
fields.description: Assisting a village in selecting its new leader.

fields.name: Supporting Peter Burst
fields.description: You have cast in your lot with the village blacksmith in his bid for the elder's chair.

fields.name: Supporting Sam Yole
fields.description: You have decided to support the local drygoodsman in his attempt to become the new village elder.

fields.name: Made Peter the Elder
fields.description: You have campaigned on behalf of Peter, the former blacksmith and new elder of a village. He owes you for his seat.

fields.name: Made Sam the Elder
fields.description: You aided Sam, a prosperous drygoodsman, in his claim to become the new elder of a village.

fields.name: Tracking Spies for House Naper
fields.description: Assisting Temor in his efforts to locate local spies.

fields.name: Spied Temor's Mistress's Connections
fields.description: You witnessed a suspicious exchange taking place between Temor's secret lover and a foreigner who may have come from the Republic.

fields.title: Graceful and Grateful
fields.description: The beasts quietly move along. You may be imagining things, but you feel like they appreciate your mercy. You also notice how their careful steps avoid crunching any twigs underfoot; following their example may help you if you ever become the hunted.

fields.title: Antlers to Admire
fields.description: On second thought, these are much too large to carry with you. Still, this tale will impress many who hear you tell it.

fields.title: Virtuous Venison
fields.description: The animal leads you on a merry chase, and you pick up a new trick or two during the pursuit. That evening, the meat tastes all the sweeter for the effort you spent.

fields.title: Blood and Coins
fields.description: Ouch, that was unpleasant to see. The mob is busy enough that they fail to notice when their blows knock loose a few coins. You nonchalantly pick up a few that roll your way.

fields.title: The Fist is Mightier than the Pen
fields.description: The first few men don't see what hit them, and the remainder are startled enough to quickly give up the fight. The grateful boy bounds off, but not before giving you a word of appreciation and the incriminating evidence.

fields.title: Aversion
fields.description: It's amazing how quickly a single shout of "Fire!" will disperse a crowd. The boy runs off before you can speak to him. Hopefully he will stay out of trouble in the future.

fields.title: A Fistful of Royals
fields.description: The lock easily yields to your prodding. Most of the contents are worthless, but you glean a few shining coins from the bottom.

fields.title: Whispers on the Wind
fields.description: You later learn that few other people noticed the star. Telling the tale impresses them, a little.

fields.title: Ask and You Shall Receive
fields.description: You certainly didn't expect your wish to be granted so quickly! Your eye catches a glimmer on the ground; groping into the dark, your fingers close around the satisfying weight of a small coin.

fields.title: Few Answers, Many Questions
fields.description: Why do stars fall? Are they really stars at all? A shooting star is a rare sight, but they happen often enough that you would expect the sky to be empty by now. If you were watching a star at the right time, could you trace its fall from the beginning? You pass several quiet minutes studying a portion of sky to memorize the positions of its lights.

fields.title: Contentment
fields.description: You sit on the ground and let the peace of the evening wash over you. Who knows what tomorrow will bring? In this moment, you feel that all is right in the world.

fields.title: Grains of Knowledge
fields.description: "Have you ever walked through a spot and unaccountably felt a shiver? Such feelings occur in places where the ether is especially thin. Outside its customary embrace, you are briefly disconnected from its continuity with the rest of the world. The next time you shiver and do not feel cold, wait there for a moment. Feel what is around you. Try to detect the ether nearby. If you can, try to pull it towards yourself and help fill the void..."

fields.title: Unified Theory of Ether
fields.description: "Well, no, we can't directly observe ether, but we can deduce its existence. Consider the wind: it has enough force to bend a tree! Yet no person has actually seen wind itself. Ether is yet another substance that we can manipulate with our bodies, which in turn can manipulate other objects. You raise a hand to toss a rock at a bottle. You purse your lips to blow your breath into a flower. And ether? Sadly, those... muscles, you might call them, are rarely used, but with enough practice you can make them push out, and create your own wave into ether..."

fields.title: Knockabout
fields.description: While the competition is in good fun, both of you clearly wish to win. You face one another, each standing still, except for flinching when a blow from ether lands on a body. You realize that he is focusing his attacks on your legs, and you shift your attentions to forming a barrier in front of them. Once he exhausts himself with his useless strikes, you counter-attack, sending one knock after another into his chest. He finally concedes the match, and shakes your hand when he hands over the coins.

fields.title: Caught in the Act!
fields.description: Just as you suspected: a rat has been trailing you. From the looks of things, it has grown fat on your largess. The extra size makes it easier to snatch on its next outing. A victory!

fields.title: A Valorous Tale
fields.description: "Ay, that was the war I thought would make me a man. Little did I think it would turn me into an old one! No, I will not tell the tale of how my fingers abandoned my hand, not until I've had more cups in me. I'll tell you instead about General Yorden, how he won his battle and lost his House's war. You see, Yorden was a maceman, and knew better than any how to drive a powerful blow against a weak spot. When he led his audacious crossing over the river and into House Gol territory, nothing could stand in his path. Once he started winning, he couldn't turn back. He ended up deep in Gol land, far in front of his supply lines, and out of touch from the real action back at the river. They say that when Naper sued for peace, he wept all the way home. Let that be a lesson for all: swing hard enough to hit, but not so hard that you can't pull back."

fields.title: A Memorable Verse
fields.description:
There was a Patriarch named Sibold
Whose daughter's ambitions were quite bold
She raised up an army
And marched them to the sea
Then back home before her lunch grew cold

fields.title: Frozen Out
fields.description: If there's one thing you've learned about the wealthy, it's that they despise competition. Try as you might to eavesdrop, they fall silent whenever you wander within range of their discussion.

fields.title: Current Market Prices
fields.description: What luck! It turns out that the middle-aged woman in blue is freshly arrived from the country, and has asked her companions for advice on selling her goods locally. You glean some useful and timely information about the excess supply of wheat flooding the markets, and what goods can earn more coin.

fields.title: Ten for You, and Ten for the House
fields.description: Picking pockets has rarely felt so easy! You gather more than you had expected, and in a fit of generosity, you order a round for the whole tavern. Everyone, including those you have just robbed, cheers you loudly. Best of all, after this display nobody will have the nerve to accuse you of theft!

fields.title: Safe, Sound, and Found
fields.description: The father is overjoyed to see his children home again. "I wish they would stop wandering off like that!" he exclaims. "One of these days, they'll learn their lesson. In the meantime, thanks be that we have good souls like you in the world."

fields.title: Smiles All Around
fields.description: The children are happy to sleep in their beds again. Their father is happy to have them back. You are happy with the new coins in your pocket. Everyone got what they wanted. One could almost wish there were more missing children in the world...

fields.title: Sputtering Riches
fields.description: You set your back on the far shore and dive. The force of the current immediately starts pulling you downstream. Fighting back and down, you plunge towards where you saw the coins. Your grasping hands pull up sand, which flies around and obscures your vision. Reaching out blindly, you cut your palm on an unusually sharp rock, and lose precious breath in an inadvertent yelp of pain. Your other hand fares better, and scoops up most of the coins before you resurface. You drag yourself to the shore, coughing and bleeding, but pleased nonetheless at your bounty.

fields.title: A Stunning View
fields.description: Amazing! While you catch your breath, you look around and drink in the landscape. Lush forests give way to rich fields, and smoke rises from a small hamlet in the distance. A hawk soars below you. People on the road look as small as ants; you wave at them with great gusto.

fields.title: Nature's Puzzles
fields.description: There's so much to learn up here in the sky that you entirely lose track of your goal. You never see those grubs in the lowlands. Several hawks fly below you, giving a rare chance to see the shape of their wings from above. And that blue flower... what's it called, Selese's Tear? It always looks sickly on the plains, but it seems to thrive up here, growing happily in the shade of giant oak trees.

fields.title: Well Shot!
fields.description: Taking down a bird on the wing seems challenging, but it's easier when you aim at a solid group of them. The murmuration of starlings hears the loud squawking of the fallen and beats a hasty retreat. You collect your coins from the impressed farmer, and help yourself to the birds as well.

fields.title: A Scary Sight
fields.description: ... or perhaps they find you too amusing? The starlings seem captivated by your antics, and coalesce from across the sky into a roiling mass over your head. Fortunately, this gives the farmer a perfect opportunity to start tossing small stones at them, and they eventually disperse. You hadn't realized that you were this captivating to living creatures. The farmer grumbles but hands over a few coins for your efforts.

fields.title: Avian Confusion
fields.description:
Working carefully, with your eyes closed, you gently push outward at the ether around you. You move it slowly enough to form a semi-solid threshold. When the next bird dives down to snatch a berry, it makes a pleasing "bonk" sound and bounces off your barrier. It angrily attempts again, as do its fellows, but they eventually realize the hopelessness of their task and fly off.\n
\n
The farmer seems awestruck at your action, and terrified by your presence. He pays you more than you expect and then graciously shoos you off his land.

fields.title: Absurdity
fields.description: It's hard to believe anyone takes this seriously. The author claims that ether is created by superior beings who live in the sky, that one must recite special words in order to tap its powers, that mastering ether allows one to create new animals and predict the future. You don't consider yourself an expert of ether, and even you know this is all false. In fact, you come to the conclusion that several other arguments made by the author are false, and glumly toss the book in the gutter after satisfying your curiosity.

fields.title: Dusty Wisdom
fields.description:
The diagrams within the book are quite useful, albeit rather familiar. They pay particular attention to the basics: the proper grasp, the shapes of various blades, how much to bend one's knees. You don't precisely learn anything new, but it's always helpful to be reminded of fundamentals, especially when they can save your life.\n
\n
A young adventuring lass spies you with the book, and offers to buy it off you. You manage to recoup much of your initial investment.

fields.title: Crevices
fields.description: At first, you are excited by the secrets the book reveals. It looks like the author painstakingly took apart dozens of locks, and carefully illustrated their components. Knowing in advance what one might encounter helps one avoid fumbling around in the dark. Your enthusiasm fades somewhat when you read the author's obsequious fawning over King Seffon; the monarch has been dead for nearly a century, so the vulnerabilities exposed by this tome have probably been corrected in all but the oldest locks you will encounter. You resolve to use the book for kindling the next time you make a campfire.

fields.title: Snatched Sign
fields.description: You deduce that the fox sign must have been erected by Pater Velkin, whose family has used that sigil for generations. It takes a few days of wandering the roads, and you need to chase off a few bandits yourself, but eventually you find it. The sign is smaller than the adventurer described, but he enthusiastically accepts it. "I can't wait for the day I can show this to my boy, and tell him about the first heroic deed done by his father! Come back tomorrow, and I'll have another job for you."

fields.title: Branches and Rocks
fields.description: The first few men don't see what hit them, but their friends are quick to pounce on you. Their anger already runs high, and you quickly decide to beat a retreat. Fortunately, the young boy has made a similar escape already.

fields.title: A Mighty Blow
fields.description: You thrash the ringleaders so thoroughly that the gang immediately disperses, howling in pain and loudly promising to leave the child alone from now on. You set off in pursuit, and they fling down copper royals in a successful effort to slow your pursuit. You split the bounty with the grateful lad. "We Mice mostly look out for ourselves, but we're grateful for those who give us aid. Perhaps one of us can return the favor to you some day."

fields.title: Go Forth and Gather
fields.description: "I'm glad you came in! You look like a capable sort. For years Tomas Raffling has brought in animals for me, but he's getting older and doesn't like to wander. Could you head out into the countryside with him and help track down some game? He'll help you bag it, and the two of you can split my payment. Here's a little something to get you started. Happy hunting!"

fields.title: Yes, Those Are Cows
fields.description: A dozen unbranded beasts contentedly munch on the wild grass. You carefully note their location, then travel back with Tomas to bring them in. Many people will eat well tonight.

fields.title: Ghosts of the Grassland
fields.description: You can't believe it. There must be hundreds of those large, lumbering beasts. Why can't you spot a single one? You resolve to return later, and maybe drag Tomas along to give you some pointers.

fields.title: Counted Sheep
fields.description: ... nineteen, twenty, twenty-one! That should provide plenty of chops and racks for the coming week. You and Tomas drive the herd into town and split the reward.

fields.title: Surprisingly Elusive
fields.description: You thought you'd spotted the errant flock, but it proved to be a distant group of white boulders. You return home empty-handed, vowing to track down the beasts in your next outing.

fields.title: Bringing Bacon
fields.description: The largest beasts leave tell-tale broken branches in their wake. You trace these back to the source, where you find many succulent specimens. Driving them into town proves challenging, but fortunately Tomas's expert pig-wrangling skills are up to the task.

fields.title: Stinky Failure
fields.description: You attempt to track the pigs by their spoor, but it only nauseates you.

fields.title: In the Bag
fields.description: Capturing enough rabbits for a single meal takes almost a full day. You learn that you can't hope to chase the rabbits once you spot them; instead, you need to predict where they will come, and then patiently wait for them to arrive. You manage to fill a squirming sack before nightfall and bring it back to the butcher. Since you didn't need Tomas's assistance, you receive the full payment for yourself.

fields.title: Where's They Go?
fields.description: You spend the entire day chasing after the swift critters. They're crafty, though, and have dug plenty of holes to escape predators like you. When the sun descends below the horizon, you're forced to admit defeat.

fields.title: Faint but Compelling
fields.description: You can't find any conclusive proof that such a creature exists, but there are definitely prints like those of a large cat in the mud. Those markings on the side of a rock could well have been from a tusk that rubbed against it. And there are definitely fewer nesting birds in this area than there were just a short time ago...

fields.title: False Trail
fields.description: You interview a man who claims to have seen the beast, and quickly determine that he was lying about the experience. He eagerly latches on to every suggestion you make and enhances it: "Yeah, it flew! It flew right over my head! And then it lay an egg! In that tree over there!" Discouraged, you wonder if anyone has actually seen the creature, or if this is all just one big hoax...

fields.title: Legendary Find
fields.description:
The first four days pass uneventfully. On the fifth, you wake immediately before dawn. Just as the rumors had said, the animal appears in the early dawn light. It doesn't charge like a boar or bound like a cougar; it seems to amble casually in your direction. It spots you, and a fraction of a second later it is at your throat. Desperately, you stumble backwards, and thrust outward with your knife. Just like that, it's over, and the no-longer-mythical beast lies at your feet.\n
\n
You hoist the boagar over your shoulders and bring it back into town. Gasps of awe mingle with shouts of acclaim as you walk through the street. You triumphantly deposit it in the butcher's shop. "Well done!" he exclaims. "We'll have to stuff this and hang it in the tavern's great hall for all to see."\n
\n
The butcher pays you the promised royals, and also gives you a sturdy vest made of cured leather. "This won't stop a spear, but it'll slow it down some. It might come in handy the next time you meet the business end of a boar!"

fields.title: Continuing to Elude
fields.description: Sadly, you fall asleep after the first night on watch. Tomas refuses to accompany you on such a bizarre quest, and without someone to share reconnaissance duties, this effort will probably fail. You resolve to try again later.

fields.title: Slipshod Work
fields.description: A deception like this requires two creatures of compatible sizes and a quiet place to work. You seem cursed by misfortune, though... your boar is too large, the cougar is actually a bobcat, and several other hunters have an annoying habit of wandering into your field and asking why you're butchering out here. Best to leave it alone for now and try again later.

fields.title: A Cunning Forgery
fields.description:
As you assemble the cryptid, you piece together a convincing story for the butcher. You always liked the detail about the boagar only appearing at dusk and at dawn; you'll claim that it emerged from the mist, that you thought at first it was a dream, that your wild flailings with a knife caused the lacerations seen around the tusks.\n
\n
The butcher buys the story, and tales of your brave exploit spread quickly throughout the town. When someone captures the actual boagar weeks later, barely anyone notices.

fields.title: Put to Work
fields.description: "I know you're new in town, and I'm glad to see you made the right choice. Now, we just need to make sure everyone else follows suit. I deserve this, you know! I was born here, grew up here, was married to three wives here. By Korol's shade, I've practically fathered a quarter of the town! Just you remind them of what they owe me, and I'll see to it that you're well rewarded."

fields.title: Solid as an Anvil
fields.description: "I'm grateful that you sought me out. Truth be told, I haven't had much fortune yet in gathering support. Sam's done a lot for the town over the years, but he's taken as much as he's given, if not more. I fear what might happen if he gains direct dominion over these peoples' lives, and not just their coin. I'll count on you to help get the word out."

fields.title: A Bad Time
fields.description: "What in the name of Yarvan are you doing here? Can't you see I'm busy? These men would have cut your throat if they thought you meant to rob me! Come back later, but next time, knock first!"

fields.title: Storytelling
fields.description: "The whole town started to go downhill when we let those peasants from the Republic in. Oh, they told pleasing tales about fleeing the chaos and needing the protective shelter of our strong Patriarch. Before they came, though, nobody would have even thought of asking the commoners about who should be elder. The Patriarch just picked someone, and that was the end of it! Febler willing, one day the Republic will be wiped off the map, and folks will forget these foolish ideas."

fields.title: Awkward Silences
fields.description: Peter has much to say about impure metals in iron ore, and about the deficiencies in the Republic's military strategies, but little to say of himself or his thoughts about the village. He eventually grows irritated and returns to the forge, whereupon you excuse yourself and venture back outside.

fields.title: Valorous Tales
fields.description: He never talks much about the village, but Peter grows quite animated when you ask him about his previous adventuring life. Once he starts rolling with tales about his close encounters with death, and narrow escapes from hopeless situations, you're able to slip in a question or two about his current life. He has few friends in the village, but cares deeply about its residents, and he mentions several people he has assisted in the past. You will need to find them later and ask for their support.

fields.title: Promises of a Better Life
fields.description: You learn that many of these people didn't even realize that the old elder is dead. You drop a few positive words in their ears about the new elder, subtly implying that his elevation is inevitable. They don't seem to care too much, which actually may help make the transition go more smoothly.

fields.title: Bored
fields.description: The first man you encounter openly yawns at the mention of your elder's name. The second man turns away and strides off. The third man mutters some excuse and leaves town. You are too discouraged to continue. Why don't they care more about their new elder?

fields.title: Firm Handshakes All Around
fields.description: Your quiet and calm words help persuade a merchant that choosing a new elder soon will help both herself and her village. She agrees to write her contact in the House, and even donates a few coins to the elder's cause.

fields.title: Frowning Faces
fields.description: Everyone seems to believe that you're after their money, their goods, or their contacts. A few even have the temerity to set their guards on you, and you decide to give them some time to cool off.

fields.title: A Quick Exchange
fields.description: Descor seems surprised at your boldness, but reins in his horse and gives you a few moments. He nods in approval at your explanation of loyalty, and promises to give both men a fair hearing. Well, that's the best one can hope for, right? Your success is worth a few royals.

fields.title: Too Fast
fields.description: Your arrival spooks the horse, and Descor trots on down the street, frowning back at you. You desperately call out your plea, but are unsure whether he hears you.

fields.title: A Quiet Chat
fields.description: Sticking to the alleys, you unobtrusively monitor Descor's progress through the town. After visiting the blacksmith and the drygoodsman, he returns to the tavern. You slip inside, and within earshot of his table, loudly extoll the virtues of your elder. He says nothing, but seems attentive to your comments. Other supporters in the bar pay for your rounds.

fields.title: Intercepted
fields.description: Sadly, your attempt at pursuit is cut short by a large man who has mistaken you for a flower thief. By the time you manage to smooth over the misunderstanding, Descor is long gone.

fields.title: A Good Listener
fields.description: Andrew is a little miffed that neither candidate has visited him in person, but you're the first representative from either camp to come and listen all the way through his stories. By the time he runs out of steam, you have a good idea of what he's looking for, and you spend a few brief moments extolling your elder's virtues before he hands you a gift and shoos you out the door.

fields.title: No Words Edgewise
fields.description: You try to tell Andrew of your candidate's fine qualities, but he keeps interrupting you with long-winded anecdotes about the time he cornered the radish market by buying off all the ships in Gubber. You eventually declare defeat and retreat.

fields.title: Tongue-Tied
fields.description: Descor glowers at you throughout your entire interview, causing you to stammer and lose track of your arguments. He abruptly rises and bits you to return when you are ready to present your case.

fields.title: A Firm Hand
fields.description:
You speak briefly and eloquently to Descor. "This decision isn't about Sam, or about Peter, or even about the village. It's about the Patriarch. What man will serve him best? One who is thoroughly invested in the well-being of our town and its commerce within the House? Or one with a history of wandering, whose trade depends on violence and conflict?"

The seating of the new elder takes place the very next day. The village's merchants all attend, including Peter, and vow to honor Sam's wisdom in the village. Sam, in turn, pledges his loyalty to the Patriarch, and slips you a large purse of royals. "You've gained a powerful friend today," he says. "Send word if you ever need a favor done."

fields.title: An Oversight
fields.description: Descor glowers at you unhappily. Too late, you realize that you have failed to pay sufficient tribute to the Patriarch. You hastily begin extolling the Patriarch's virtues, but it is too late, and Descor asks you to return tomorrow.

fields.title: Installed
fields.description:
You have a sense that Descor has done some adventuring in his own time, and play on this potential affinity with Peter. "Sam may have roots in the community, but Peter has roots in the whole land. He's traveled throughout the House, and knows well the sorts of trials that a village like this might encounter. And, should the worst occur and this town come under attack, you can count on Peter to inspire the locals to take up arms until the Patriarch's army arrives."\n
\n
Peter is seated on the chair the very next day. A variety of people attend, from farmers to laborers to merchants. He gives a few brief words of thanks while Sam glowers behind him. When you celebrate in the tavern later that night, Peter approaches for a few words. "I don't know why you decided to spend so much time helping me, but I'm very grateful that you did. I can't truly repay you for your assistance. I will let my old friends know of your deeds, and they may help you find new opportunities."

fields.title: A Rocky Course
fields.description: Descor seems confused. "Why do you speak to me of Sam? What can you tell me of Peter?" He seems unsatisfied by your answers.

fields.title: A Coup
fields.description:
Descor initially seems surprised by your about-face, but gradually warms to your idea to elevate Sam to the chair. "You have certainly spent more time in this village than me, and you have seen both men at their best and worst. Peter has struck me as a fair and honest man, but fairness and honesty do not always make for the best leader. Tell Sam that he has the victory."\n
\n
Sam practically crows with delight during his seating ceremony, strutting around his house in triumph. Peter is nowhere to be seen; rumors say that he has sold his shop and returned to the road. "You backed the wrong man, but you came around in the end, and I respect that. Such efforts deserve to be rewarded well."

fields.title: Denied Entry
fields.description: It seems that Sam has anticipated your potential treachery. Another courier of his is already inside Descor's lodging rooms, whispering urgently. They both glare as you approach, and you decide to leave for now.

fields.title: A Solid Smith
fields.description:
Descor initially balks at the thought of choosing Peter, but soon grows convinced of your good intentions. "Kaman knows that Peter doesn't have money to bribe you, so if he's convinced you that he's the better elder, then I'm inclined to believe you. I never really liked that drygoodsman, anyways. We'll hold the ceremony in the morning."\n
\n
As is customary, the elder's chair is moved into Peter's dwelling, and he is invited to sit by the Patriarch's representative. Sam is nowhere to be seen; he apparently decided to travel with his caravan to miss the indignity of observing his rival's ascension. Peter does not speak long, but carefully singles you out for praise, as a fine example for the village's youth to emulate.

fields.title: Congratulations!
fields.description: The stablemaster is sad to see the horse go, but seems pleased that you are the owner. "She forages for herself mostly, just be sure to let her graze each day, and brush her down when she needs it. You take care of her, and she'll serve you a good, long time."

fields.title: "Stop! Thief!"
fields.description: Few things are as hated in town as a horse-thief. You run away from your pursuers, but are nearly trampled below their hooves as they chase after you.

fields.title: Possession is Law
fields.description: You slip into the tavern behind your mark, then shortly walk back out again. Acting casual, you mount and swiftly ride off. You'll need to avoid this area of town for the near future; in the meantime, you make sure that as many people as possible associate you with this steed.

fields.title: Commissioned
fields.description:
You approach Temor so quietly that he jumps up when you speak his name. "Blast, look what you've made me do! Go order me another pint of the black!"

By the time you return, he has calmed down and has a proposition for you. "I desperately need to locate some sneaky men, and you seem like the kind of sneak who could help me out. I was carrying some important messages for the Patriarch through this area last month. I learned last week that... some potential enemies of the House have learned of those messages' contents. I'll be punished no matter what, but if I can identify the man or woman who spied the messages, I may get to keep my head. Here's a list of suspects to investigate. Report back to me once you have learned their identity."

fields.title: Upstanding Citizen
fields.description: You're reasonably sure that Sam doesn't spot you throughout the whole day. He receives a steady flow of customers, all of whom seem to be local residents or nearby farmers. You report your findings to Temor, who pays you for your time.

fields.title: A Consummate Salesman
fields.description: Unfortunately, Sam makes it a point to spot anyone who looks like a potential customer, and sell them whatever overstock he has at the moment. You repeatedly deny that you need any miniature wineskins, and eventually leave.

fields.title: Snapped Twigs and Lost Pride
fields.description: Curses! You realize that she has known for hours that you were following, and has merely been tweaking you by going in circles. If she is guilty, she certainly won't give anything away today.

fields.title: Far Traveler
fields.description: You manage to remain unseen throughout the day as the huntress goes about her work. She kills several rabbits and an impressive buck deer, but does not meet a single soul.

fields.title: Spotted!
fields.description: The boy realizes that you've been following him, and loses you by running through a crowded market. You vow to be more cautious next time.

fields.title: A Suspicious Meeting
fields.description:
How unusual! The boy usually only pauses for a few moments in front of each door, either delivering or taking a letter, but at one house he enters and remains inside for some time. Sneaking closer to the window, you spy him sitting with several men and women. Their clothes look foreign... are they from House Gattar, perhaps? Or maybe the Republic?

The evidence seems circumstantial, but still worth reporting to Temor. He is happy to pay you for your observation, and asks you to continue gathering information.

fields.title: A Meeting
fields.description:
How unusual! The boy usually only pauses for a few moments in front of each door, either delivering or taking a letter, but at one house he enters and remains inside for some time. Sneaking closer to the window, you spy him sitting with several men and women. Their clothes look foreign... are they from House Gattar, perhaps? Or maybe the Republic?

Emboldened, you creep even nearer the house until you can hear their conversation. It sounds like the strangers are distant relatives who plan to form a letter-delivery service that will run throughout Skal. An ambitious plan, certainly, but likely not connected to your current task.

You hear a loud cough behind you. A large and much-scarred man stares disapprovingly. He hands you a few royals. "Please keep silent about what you've seen," he warns.

fields.title: A Light Sleeper
fields.description: You had hoped to catch him unawares by entering at night, but creaky floorboards doom your effort. Fortunately, his limp prevents him from catching you during your swift flight back down the stairs.

fields.title: Suspicious Correspondence
fields.description:
You silently creep into his room around midnight. Finding a few letters, you hold them up to the moonlight and read them carefully.

It sounds as though the adventurer is a trader in information. He has learned embarrassing facts about Patriarch Gol's grand-daughter, has predicted a rush on cotton stocks in Gubber, and has received early reports of a promising gold dig in north Talimar. Still, nothing in here implicates House Naper. Is he innocent, or just very careful?

fields.title: Too Visible
fields.description: "Hey, there! Can I get you a drink? Well, if you aren't paying, kindly scram!"

fields.title: Foreign Agents
fields.description:
You would have missed it entirely if you had let you attention wander for even a few seconds. A plain-looking man in ragged but clean clothes comes to the bar and orders a drink, and you see him pass a small slip of paper along with the royals he gives to her.

The paper disappears in her blouse, and the man heads to the door with a bottle in hand. You follow him back to the edge of town, where a carriage is waiting. No sigil is visible on the exterior, but the carriage's construction - burnished cherry panels, iron clasps that look plain but well-made - seems to imply that it is of Republic make. What would a Republic carriage be doing here?

fields.title: Insufficient Evidence
fields.description:
Temor sounds elated when you announce that the messenger is guilty. "I knew it! That boy always struck me as sneaky. Tell me, were you able to recover copies of the messages?"

You confess that you were not, and Temor's mood sours. "How am I supposed to convince the Patriarch that he's responsible if I have no proof? I'll be even more doomed than I am now. Keep looking, there must be more to find!"

fields.title: Insufficient Evidence
fields.description:
Temor is surprised at the identity of the culprit. "In all honesty, I thought he was a bit of a long shot. I never understood how a man with such limited mobility could have stolen a copy of my message. Tell me, were you able to recover it?"

You confess that you were not, and Temor's mood sours. "How am I supposed to convince the Patriarch that the adventurer is responsible if I have no proof? I'll be even more doomed than I am now. Keep looking, there must be more to find!"

fields.title: A Mystery Solved
fields.description:
Temor flushes in anger. "How dare you besmirch her? Her, and my own reputation? I'll have you thrown in my uncle's dungeon!"

You quietly describe the exchange you witnessed between the barkeep and the foreigner, and Temor's rage quickly dissipates. He motions for you to leave the tavern, and the two of you return to his lodgings. Inside, he begins to pace, connecting the dots as he speaks out loud.

"I think I've made a huge mistake. I've known Misty for several years, and have always taken good care of her. When I'd received this assignment to cultivate dissidents within the Republic, I traveled through this town to see her, even though it was out of my way. Yes... I was, ah, unguarded after our meeting, and she certainly would have been able to look through my effects without my realizing. But why?"

A light appears in Temor's eye. "Ahhh... she must be a sympathizer! Many people born outside of House lineage are attracted by the foolish claims of the Republic, and believe that if they could only join it, they would be showered with wealth and prestige. All her declarations of loyalty to House Naper were a ruse. She is a spy, and we must bring her to the Patriarch!"

Temor rushes back to the tavern once more, but it is too late: Misty has gone. The tavernkeeper seems ignorant of what has transpired. "She saw you and that man walking for the door, then she turned pale and ran out the back. I hope she comes back soon, I can't serve all these drinks by myself!"

You receive a significant rewards from Temor before he rides back to the House. "You have my thanks for all your assistance. I will most likely be executed within a week, but at least my uncle will know the truth of what has happened. I will tell him of your loyalty to us; perhaps you will be able to serve him better in the future."
